article.headline: Drexel 62, Saint Joseph's 50
article.story: PHILADELPHIA -- Sophomore Daryl McCoy posted career highs of 15 points and 18 rebounds as Drexel defeated Saint Joseph's 62-50 on Wednesday night. McCoy's 18 rebounds were the most in a game by a Dragons player since the 1996 season, when Malik Rose grabbed 19 boards in the North Atlantic Conference championship game. McCoy shot 7 of 8 from the field and 1 of 2 from the free-throw line. Chris Fouch added 17 points for Drexel (4-1) and Samme Givens had 10 rebounds and nine points. The Hawks (3-3) led by five in the first half, but the Dragons used a 13-5 run to lead 31-28 at the break. Saint Joseph's got as close as 39-34 with 11:17 to go, then McCoy scored on a dunk and Fouch on a 3-pointer to push the lead into double digits. Drexel outrebounded the Hawks 46-23, taking a 17-4 advantage on the offensive boards. Carl Jones scored 20 to lead Saint Joseph's.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
